cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (potential – not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WSW today, turning west on Thursday, then WNW to NW Friday-Saturday toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City, LA (Tropical-Storm and Storm-Surge Watches)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southeastern Louisiana coast, with effects possible westward toward the Upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) are possible late Friday into Saturday with a 70 % chance; a 33 % chance exists for winds ≥ 58 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge currently forecast for Lake Charles (surge watch is east of the port); minor coastal flooding <3 ft possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Very heavy rain possible; 6–12 inches with locally higher amounts could fall across southwest Louisiana, including Lake Charles.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Fresh-water flooding of rivers and bayous and isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands could disrupt port operations.
